semantic_title: Anemia Associated with Chemotherapy, Immunotherapy and Radiation Therapy
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > c. Coding and sequencing of complications > 2) Anemia associated with chemotherapy, immunotherapy and radiation therapy

content.full_text: When the admission/encounter is for management of an anemia associated with an adverse effect of the administration of chemotherapy or immunotherapy and the only treatment is for the anemia, the anemia code is sequenced first followed by the appropriate codes for the neoplasm and the adverse effect (T45.1X5-, Adverse effect of antineoplastic and immunosuppressive drugs). When the admission/encounter is for management of an anemia associated with an adverse effect of radiotherapy, the anemia code should be sequenced first, followed by the appropriate neoplasm code and code Y84.2, Radiological procedure and radiotherapy as the cause of abnormal reaction of the patient, or of later complication, without mention of misadventure at the time of the procedure. (Evidence: pg no: 34, L32-L39)
content.summary: Sequencing guidelines for anemia caused by cancer treatments (chemotherapy, immunotherapy, radiation) (Evidence: pg no: 34, L32-L39)
key_concepts: Anemia from chemotherapy/immunotherapy adverse effects (Evidence: pg no: 34, L34-L36)

Different external cause codes for different treatments (Evidence: pg no: 34, L37, L39)

detailed_rules.rule_text: For chemotherapy/immunotherapy-induced anemia: anemia code first, then neoplasm, then T45.1X5- (Evidence: pg no: 34, L34-L37)
detailed_rules.explanation: When anemia is caused by chemotherapy or immunotherapy adverse effects, the anemia takes precedence in sequencing, followed by the underlying neoplasm and the adverse effect code (Evidence: pg no: 34, L34-L37)
detailed_rules.applies_to: anemia caused by chemotherapy or immunotherapy
common_applications: Patient develops anemia from chemotherapy treatment
Patient has anemia from immunotherapy side effects

detailed_rules.rule_text: For radiotherapy-induced anemia: anemia code first, then neoplasm, then Y84.2 (Evidence: pg no: 34, L38-L39)
detailed_rules.explanation: When anemia is caused by radiotherapy adverse effects, sequence anemia first, followed by neoplasm code and Y84.2 for radiotherapy complications (Evidence: pg no: 34, L38-L39)
common_applications: Patient develops anemia from radiation therapy treatment

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify if anemia is from chemotherapy/immunotherapy or radiotherapy
Step 2: Sequence anemia code as principal/first-listed diagnosis
Step 3: Add appropriate neoplasm code as secondary
Step 4: Add appropriate external cause code (T45.1X5- or Y84.2)
